subject: Re: [junit] Problem with configuration classes
msgSnippet: ... Correct.  The code in the factory is no more than getter/setter simplicity.  You could still test it, if you want, that it creates EventListeners with the
messageBody:
On Sun, 07 Sep 2003 14:55:09 +0200, "trz" <lbolzani@...> said:
> Jason Rogers wrote:
> this is another possible solution, but I think the factory problem is
> still there.
> Even in this case I'll need a ListenerFactory to create a Listener set
> up with all the handlers I need.
> The code in the factory would be a little simpler: do you think as much
> not to need to unit test it?

Correct. The code in the factory is no more than getter/setter
simplicity. You could still test it, if you want, that it creates
EventListeners with the proper handlers. I would tend not to test it
unless it proves 'breakable.' There is a fine line I draw, I guess,
between testing code that could break and defensive testing (against
other programmers in the same code base).

--
=jason
[:question | ^One]
